attributes.comment:
To Whom it May Concern,

Please accept my feedback on your proposed fee increase to complete the process
of receiving an I-171H.

I am disappointed with the idea of an increase in the required fees. I
encourage you to look elsewhere to increase revenue or reduce the operating
budget.

As an adoptive family, we have paid substantial fees throughout the entire
adoption process. And many families have been involved in expensive infertility
treatments before deciding to pursue an adoption. It is heartbreaking to think
of children that may never have a permanent family due to the costs involved in
adoption. Fee increases through the Department of Homeland Security and other
agencies may exclude many wonderful potential parents from offering a loving
home to an orphan.

Please consider the number of visa applications issued to bring a child home
from China. Due to the increased time line on the part of China to receive a
referral, many families including my own will be required to reapply for an
updated I-171H. This means we will be paying the required fees twice, without
ever using the first approved I-171H.

It would be reasonable to maintain the current fees throughout the time period
in which families must apply twice, as this generates additional revenue.
Reconsider increasing your fees when the time comes that families adopting from
China only need one application due to either Congress extending the expiration
date of the I-171H or China decreasing the period of time to issue a referral.

I appreciate the opportunity to comment on your proposed fee increases. Thank
you for taking the time to seriously consider our opinions on the matter as you
weigh all of you options.

Sincerely,
Kerrie Grove
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Kerrie J. Grove
